ab_testing_experiments.name: Hero Headline Variants
ab_testing_experiments.hypothesis: A headline emphasizing health benefits ('Guilt-Free Indulgence') will convert better than a tradition-focused headline ('Ancient Taste, Modern Treat') because modern consumers prioritize wellness over nostalgia.

variants.headline: MitthuuG — Premium Til-Gud Bites: Ancient Taste, Modern Treat
Guilt-Free Indulgence: 100% Natural Til-Gud Bites
variants.reasoning: Leads with health benefit and natural ingredients

variants.headline: Handcrafted Sesame & Jaggery Bites — No Refined Sugar

ab_testing_experiments.minimum_sample_size: 1,500 visitors per variant (assumes 5% baseline CTR, 80% power, 95% confidence)
ab_testing_experiments.success_criteria: Winning variant shows >15% improvement in CTR with statistical significance (p < 0.05)
ab_testing_experiments.implementation_notes: Test on homepage hero only. Keep subheadline and CTA consistent across variants.

ab_testing_experiments.name: CTA Button: Color vs. Copy
ab_testing_experiments.hypothesis: Changing CTA copy from generic 'Shop Now' to urgency-driven 'Try Our Sampler' will increase conversion, as it lowers commitment anxiety for first-time visitors.
ab_testing_experiments.success_criteria: Winning variant shows >20% improvement in conversion rate with p < 0.05
ab_testing_experiments.implementation_notes: Run on homepage hero CTA and product listing page. Track which variant drives most Trial Pack purchases.

ab_testing_experiments.name: Product Page Layout: Image Gallery vs. Lifestyle Focus
ab_testing_experiments.hypothesis: A product page layout emphasizing lifestyle images (people enjoying bites, chai pairings) will convert better than a traditional gallery of product shots, as it helps customers visualize usage.

variants.layout: Traditional gallery: Hero product shot + 3-4 detail/ingredient images
Lifestyle-first: Hero lifestyle image + usage scenarios + 1 product detail shot

ab_testing_experiments.success_criteria: Winning variant shows >10% improvement in add-to-cart rate
ab_testing_experiments.implementation_notes: Test on Classic Til-Gud Bites product page first (highest traffic). If successful, roll out to all products.

ab_testing_experiments.name: Urgency Messaging: Scarcity vs. Freshness
ab_testing_experiments.hypothesis: Messaging emphasizing freshness ('Made fresh in small batches daily') will outperform scarcity messaging ('Only 10 packs left') because the target audience values quality over FOMO for premium food products.

variants.message: Only {X} packs left in stock — order soon!
variants.placement: Product page, below Add to Cart button

variants.message: Fresh batch crafted today — ships within 24 hours ✓
variants.placement: Product page, below Add to Cart button

ab_testing_experiments.success_criteria: Winning variant shows >12% improvement in conversion rate + equal or higher satisfaction scores
ab_testing_experiments.implementation_notes: Monitor for any negative brand perception impact. Survey customers post-purchase asking what influenced their decision.

ab_testing_experiments.name: Bundle Messaging: Value vs. Variety
ab_testing_experiments.hypothesis: Framing the Trial Pack as 'Discover Your Favorite Flavor' (variety-focused) will convert better than 'Best Value — 3 for the Price of 2' (price-focused) because premium customers prioritize experience over savings.

variants.messaging: Discover Your Favorite — Try All 3 Flavors

secondary_metrics: Click-through rate on Trial Pack listing
Repeat purchase rate (do customers return for full-size after trial?)
ab_testing_experiments.minimum_sample_size: 800 visitors to Trial Pack page per variant
ab_testing_experiments.estimated_duration: 10-14 days (plus 60-day follow-up to track repeat purchases)
ab_testing_experiments.success_criteria: Winning variant shows >15% improvement in Trial Pack sales + higher repeat purchase rate within 60 days
ab_testing_experiments.implementation_notes: Track long-term impact on customer retention. Variant that drives more repeat customers wins even if initial conversion is slightly lower.

testing_framework.statistical_significance: Aim for 95% confidence level (p < 0.05) before declaring a winner
avoid_common_pitfalls: Don't stop tests too early (wait for minimum sample size)
Don't test during unusual traffic spikes (festivals, sales)
Don't change multiple elements at once (unless multivariate)
Don't ignore mobile vs desktop performance differences
testing_framework.prioritization: Run experiments in this order: #1 (Hero Headline) → #2 (CTA) → #3 (Product Layout) → #4 (Urgency) → #5 (Bundle). Hero and CTA have highest traffic and biggest potential impact.
